title: Teenagers with period pain more likely to have chronic adult pain, study says
summary: A recent study reveals that 15-year-olds experiencing dysmenorrhea have a 76% higher risk of complications compared to their peers without painful menses. This research highlights the significant impact of menstrual pain on adolescent health. The findings aim to raise awareness and inform better management strategies for affected individuals.

title: US Open: Alcaraz wins, Krejcikova beats Townsend after saving eight match points – as it happened
summary: Carlos Alcaraz dazzled in his quarter-final match, joining Jessica Pegula, who also advanced. Meanwhile, Barbora Krejcikova secured a thrilling victory over Taylor Townsend. The tournament showcased impressive performances from these top players.

title: Nicolas Jackson forced to return to Chelsea after Bayern pull out of deal
summary: Nicolas Jackson is staying in Germany to push for a transfer to Bayern Munich. However, negotiations between Bayern and Chelsea have failed to reach an agreement. As a result, Jackson’s move to the German club remains uncertain.

title: Police officer ‘punched in face’ as four arrested at London anti-asylum protest
summary: The Metropolitan Police reported that a small group of aggressive masked protesters disrupted a previously peaceful demonstration in the Isle of Dogs. Authorities emphasized the importance of maintaining public order during such events. The situation reflects ongoing tensions surrounding protests in the area.
